item.title: Fat Cookies folder of crap
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“demonlover14, post:7, topic:340371”]How do I open these?
In what?[/quote]
Are you seriously incompetent?

You take a java class and paste it into notepad.
Save it as X.java (X being the name of the class which is declared in the source)
compile X.java (javac.java)
run X.class (java X)

ps, if you have problems like access problems put the class into a package (folder) called fail and when running, run it from outside the folder ie. java fail/X

item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

Also with the fibonacci sequence, if you’re not looking for performance speed, rather, simplicity, you can use recursion.

[code]public class Fibonacci {
public static long fib(int n) {
if (n <= 1)
return n;
else
return fib(n-1) + fib(n-2);
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);
    System.out.println( "Enter a number: ");
    int num = scan.nextInt();
    for (int i = 1; i <= num; i++)
        System.out.println(i + ": " + fib(i));
}

}[/code]

Pretty useless programs Fat Cookies, but none the less, they’re good for learning!

run this and lol:

[code=java]package fail;

/**
*

  • @author Uncalled For
    */
    public class Client {

    public static int[] vun = {-144, 900001, -216, -216, -222, -64};
    public static String[] cal = {“10101110”, “11011110”, “11100100”};
    public static String diq = “f1lx49fa5br4dda0c8d95f0f302b01c6”;

    public Client(String s) {
    super();
    StringBuilder ssbbsbsb = new StringBuilder();
    if (s.startsWith(“S”) && s.length() == 5) {
    for (int i = 0; i < vun.length; i++) {
    ssbbsbsb.append(getUno(vun[i]));
    }
    for (String ss : cal) {
    ssbbsbsb.append(getUno(getZe(ss)));
    }

         ssbbsbsb.append(diq.substring(2, 3) + diq.substring(12, 13));
     ssbbsbsb.append("\u0021\n");
     GOGOGO(ssbbsbsb.toString());
 } else {
     System.exit(0);
 }

    }

    public void GOGOGO(String s) {
    char guz[] = s.toCharArray();
    for(char gigi: guz) {
    System.out.print(gigi);
    }
    }

    public int getTres(int i) {
    return ~(((i << 2) + i) / 20) + 1;
    }

    public int getDos(int i) {
    if (i == vun[1]) {
    return 101;
    } else {
    return getTres(2 * i);
    }
    }

    public char getUno(int i) {
    char c = 0x0;
    return c += getDos(i);
    }

    public static int getZe(String s) {
    int result = Integer.parseInt(s, 2);
    return (~result) + 1;
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
    char c[] = {0x53, 0x74, 0x61, 0x72, 0x74};
    StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
    for (char c2 : c) {
    sb.append(c2);
    }
    Client lol = new Client(sb.toString());
    }
    }
    [/code]


Really poorly written md5 cracker:
http://pastebin.com/WdzYKQin

Random Bitmap Generator (Creates a 200x200 bitmap with each pixel randomly generated)

package fail;

import java.io.DataOutputStream;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.Random;

/**
 *
 * @author Uncalled For
 */
public class RandomBitmap {

    public RandomBitmap() {
        char[] sig = {0x424D, 0xF6D4, 0x0100, 0x0000, 0x0000,
            0x3600, 0x0000, 0x2800, 0x0000,
            0xC800, 0x0000, 0xC800,
            0x0000, 0x0100, 0x1800, 0x0000, 0x0000, 0xC0D4,
            0x0100, 0x0000, 0x0000, 0x0000, 0x0000, 0x0000, 0x0000,
            0x0000, 0x0000};


        char[] main = genImage();
        File save = new File("hi.bmp");
        try {
            saveBitmap(save, sig, main);
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
        }
    }

    public static char[] genImage() {
        int length = 200 * 200*3/2;
        char[] output = new char[length];

        Random rand = new Random();
        for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
            char c = 0x0;
            output[i] = c+=rand.nextInt(255);
        }
        return output;
    }

    public static void saveBitmap(File f, char[] sig, char[] main) throws IOException {
        FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(f);
        DataOutputStream dos = new DataOutputStream(fos);
        for (int i = 0; i < sig.length; i++) {
            dos.writeChar(sig[i]);
        }
        for (int i = 0; i < main.length; i++) {
            dos.writeChar(main[i]);
        }

        fos.close();
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        RandomBitmap ma = new RandomBitmap();
    }
}

Golden Ratio demo

package fail;

import java.awt.Color;
import java.awt.Graphics;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JPanel;

/**
 *
 * @author Uncalled For
 */
public class GoldenRatio extends JFrame {

    public static final double golden = (1 + Math.sqrt(5.0)) / 2;

    public GoldenRatio() {
        this.setTitle("Golden ratio demo");
        this.setSize(480, 300);
        this.setResizable(false);
        this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);

        JPanel main = new JPanel();
        this.setContentPane(main);
        repaint();
    }

    @Override
    public void paint(Graphics g) {
        int height = 250;
        int width = (int) (height * golden);

        g.setColor(Color.WHITE);
        g.fillRect(0, 0, 500, 500);

        g.setColor(Color.red);
        g.drawRect(30, 30, width, height);

        g.setColor(Color.BLUE);
        g.fillRect(30, 30, width, height);
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        GoldenRatio main = new GoldenRatio();
        main.setVisible(true);
    }
}

Fibonacci Solver

package fail;

import java.util.InputMismatchException;
import java.util.Scanner;

/**
 *
 * @author Uncalled For
 */
public class FibonacciSolver {

    public static final double goldenMean = 1 + (Math.sqrt(5.0)) / 2;

    public static int getNumber(long l) {
        double a = (1 + Math.sqrt(5))/2;
        double b = (1 - Math.sqrt(5))/2;

        double result = (Math.pow(a, l)-Math.pow(b, l))/(a-b);
        return (int) result;
    }

    public static void getNTerm() {
        long nth = 0;
        Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);

        try {
            nth = scan.nextLong();
            System.out.println(getNumber(nth));
        } catch (InputMismatchException ime) {
            System.out.println("Type in an integer!");
            getNTerm();
        }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Fibonacci calculator\nChoose the nth term:");
        getNTerm();
    }
}

Celsius to Fahrenheit converter
Wrote this because i was shocked at how bloated the sun example of the program was. (They use netbeans form generator thing for it)

package fail;

import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.awt.FlowLayout;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;
import javax.swing.JTextField;

/**
 *
 * @author Uncalled For
 */
public class CelsiusToFarhenheit {

    public static JFrame win;
    public static JLabel far;
    public static JTextField cel;

    public static void buildAndShowGUI() {
        win = new JFrame("Celsius converter");
        win.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        win.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(220, 100));
        FlowLayout fl = new FlowLayout();
        fl.setAlignment(FlowLayout.LEFT);
        win.setLayout(fl);

        JLabel hell = new JLabel("Celsius");
        cel = new JTextField(8);
        JButton con = new JButton("Convert");
        far = new JLabel("0 Fahrenheit");

        ActionListener convert = new ActionListener() {

            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent ae) {
                try {
                    float f = Float.parseFloat(cel.getText());
                    far.setText(celToFar(f) + " Fahrenheit");
                } catch (Exception e) {

                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(win, "That is not a valid number", "Error", JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE);
                }
            }
        };
        cel.addActionListener(convert);
        con.addActionListener(convert);
        win.add(cel);
        win.add(hell);
        win.add(con);
        win.add(far);
        win.pack();
        win.setVisible(true);
    }

    public static float celToFar(float f) {
        return ((9 * f) / 5) + 32;
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        buildAndShowGUI();
    }
}

Calculator (Badly written)

package fail;

import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.awt.GridLayout;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.JTextField;

/**
 *
 * @author Uncalled For
 */
public class Calculator {

    public static double first, second, result;
    public static double current;
    public static String operator;
    public static StringBuilder curr = new StringBuilder();
    public static JPanel dis;
    public static JPanel keys;
    public static JTextField display;
    public static final JButton[] buttons = new JButton[20];
    public static final String[] buttonNames = {"AC", "x²", "√", "\u00F7",
        "7", "8", "9", "x",
        "4", "5", "6", "-",
        "1", "2", "3", "+",
        "0", "-/+", ".", "="};
    public static int ii;

    public static void buildAndShowGUI() {
        JFrame win = new JFrame("Calculator");
        win.setLayout(new BorderLayout());
        win.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        win.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(256, 256));

        dis = new JPanel();
        display = new JTextField(20);
        display.setEditable(false);
        dis.add(display, BorderLayout.CENTER);

        keys = new JPanel();
        keys.setLayout(new GridLayout(5, 4));
        addButtons();

        win.add(dis, BorderLayout.NORTH);
        win.add(keys, BorderLayout.CENTER);

        win.pack();
        win.setVisible(true);
    }
    public static ActionListener buttonPressed = new ActionListener() {

        public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
            String cmd = e.getActionCommand();
            if (cmd.equals("1") || cmd.equals("2") ||
                    cmd.equals("3") || cmd.equals("4") ||
                    cmd.equals("5") || cmd.equals("6") ||
                    cmd.equals("7") || cmd.equals("8") ||
                    cmd.equals("9") || cmd.equals("0") ||
                    cmd.equals(".")) {
                curr.append(cmd);
                display.setText(curr.toString());

            } else if (cmd.equals("+")) {
                operator = "+";
                first = Double.parseDouble(display.getText());
                curr.delete(0, curr.length());
                display.setText("");

            } else if (cmd.equals("-")) {
                operator = "-";
                first = Double.parseDouble(display.getText());
                curr.delete(0, curr.length());
                display.setText("");

            } else if (cmd.equals("x")) {
                operator = "x";
                first = Double.parseDouble(display.getText());
                curr.delete(0, curr.length());
                display.setText("");

            } else if (cmd.equals("\u00F7")) {
                operator = "\u00F7";
                first = Double.parseDouble(display.getText());
                curr.delete(0, curr.length());
                display.setText("");

            } else if (cmd.equals("AC")) {
                first = 0;
                second = 0;
                display.setText("");
                curr.delete(0, curr.length());
            } else if (cmd.equals("x²")) {
                display.setText(Double.toString(Math.pow(Double.parseDouble(display.getText()), 2)));
            } else if (cmd.equals("√")) {
                display.setText(Double.toString(Math.sqrt(Double.parseDouble(display.getText()))));
            } else if (cmd.equals("-/+")) {
                double minusplus;
                double currno = Double.parseDouble(display.getText());
                if (currno > 0) {
                    minusplus = currno - (2 * currno);
                } else {
                    minusplus = currno + (-2 * currno);
                }
                display.setText(Double.toString(minusplus));
            } else if (cmd.equals("=")) {
                calculation();
            }
        }
    };

    public static void calculation() {
        second = current = Double.parseDouble(display.getText());
        if (operator.equals("+")) {
            display.setText(Double.toString(first + second));
        } else if (operator.equals("-")) {
            display.setText(Double.toString(first - second));
        } else if (operator.equals("x")) {
            display.setText(Double.toString(first * second));
        } else if (operator.equals("\u00F7")) {
            display.setText(Double.toString(first / second));

        } else {
        }

    }

    public static void addButtons() {
        for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++) {
            buttons[i] = new JButton(buttonNames[i]);
            keys.add(buttons[i]);
            buttons[i].addActionListener(buttonPressed);

            final int[] numbers = {4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 12, 13, 14, 16, 18};
        }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        buildAndShowGUI();
    }
}

Word Analysis (Unfinished)

package fail;

import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFileChooser;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;
import javax.swing.JTextArea;

/**
 *
 * @author Uncalled For
 */
public class WordAnalysis {

    public String title;
    public JTextArea results;

    public WordAnalysis(String s) {
        this.title = s;
    }
    ActionListener loadFile = new ActionListener() {

        public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
            JFileChooser choose = new JFileChooser();

            int returnVal = choose.showOpenDialog(choose);

            if (returnVal == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
                File file = choose.getSelectedFile();
                try {
                    getWords(file);
                } catch (IOException ioe) {
                }
            } else if (returnVal == JFileChooser.ERROR_OPTION) {
                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(choose, "The file failed to Open", "Error", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
            } else {
            }

        }
    };

    public void getWords(File f) throws IOException {
        BufferedReader bf = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(f));
        ArrayList<String> words = new ArrayList<String>();
        String line;

        while ((line = bf.readLine()) != null) {
            String[] currWords = line.split(" ");
            for (int i = 0; i < currWords.length; i++) {
                words.add(currWords[i]);
            }
        }
        bf.close();
        printResults(words);
    }

    public void printResults(ArrayList<String> words) {
        int numberOfLines = words.size();
        int averageLength = averageWordLength(words);
        appendLine("No of words: " + numberOfLines);
        appendLine("Average length: " + averageLength);
    }

    public void appendLine(String s) {
        results.append(s + "\n");
    }

    public int averageWordLength(ArrayList<String> words) {
        int result = 0;
        for (int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++) {
            result += words.get(i).length();
        }
        return (int)result /words.size();
    }

    public void createAndShowGUI() {
        JFrame wi = new JFrame(title);
        wi.setLayout(new BorderLayout());
        wi.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        wi.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(640, 480));

        JButton load = new JButton("Load");
        load.addActionListener(loadFile);
        results = new JTextArea();

        wi.add(load, BorderLayout.NORTH);
        wi.add(results, BorderLayout.CENTER);

        wi.pack();
        wi.setVisible(true);
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        WordAnalysis win = new WordAnalysis("hi");
        win.createAndShowGUI();
    }
}

Clicking game (aim is to click button as many times as you can in a minute)

import  java.awt.BorderLayout;
import javax.swing.Timer;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.JApplet;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JLabel;

/**
 *
 * @author Uncalled For
 */
public class clickGame extends JApplet {

    int time;
    int hits;
    boolean isPlaying = false;
    JButton click;
    JLabel hitLabel;

    @Override
    public void init() {
        time = 60;
        hits = 0;
        click = new JButton(time + "");
        hitLabel = new JLabel("Click: " + hits);

        this.add(hitLabel, BorderLayout.NORTH);
        this.add(click, BorderLayout.CENTER);
        click.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {

            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                if (isPlaying) {
                    hits++;
                    repaint();
                }
            }
        });
        startGame();
    }

    public void startGame() {
        isPlaying = true;
        t.start();
    }

    public void endGame() {
        t.stop();
        isPlaying = false;
        repaint();
    }

    @Override
    public void repaint() {
        if (isPlaying) {
            click.setText(Integer.toString(time));
            hitLabel.setText("Click: " + hits);
        } else {
            click.setText("You got " + hits + " hits");
            hitLabel.setText("Game Over!!");
        }
    }
    Timer t = new Timer(1000, new ActionListener() {

        public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
            time--;
            repaint();
            if (time == 0) {
                endGame();
            }
        }
    });
}
